instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CD3217: What is CD3217? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO: What is PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO? PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO is an LDO coming out of the CD3215 USB-C muxing/charging chip. This can be shorted to ground by the capacitor on its line, and when this happens, the chip can stop functioning which causes the charger to not turn on..
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.I2C_PWR_SDA: What is I2C_PWR_SDA? I2C_PWR_SDA is the SMBUS data line between the system management controller(SMC), battery, ISL9240 battery charging chip, and power management unit(PMU). This line is necessary for the machine to communicate with the battery, see the battery, and use the battery. When this line is malfunctioning or shorted to ground, the machine will have an X icon over the battery and not run off the battery. .
definitions.P5VG3S_EN: What is P5VG3S_EN? This signal enables the PP5V_G3S power rail when it is high. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .
definitions.PP3V3_G3S: What is PP3V3_G3S? PP3V3_G3S is a 3.3v power rail present when the machine is in a G3S standby state. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wont charge 5V 0.280A without battery 20V with battery.
threads.message:
Clean board, no history.

PPBUS 12.3V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_RTC_X</SIGNAL> 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO</SIGNAL> 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO</SIGNAL> 1.5V

Already replaced all <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP> and also <CHIP>U2890</CHIP>/UB090 from same board model donor.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wont charge 5V 0.280A without battery 20V with battery.
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO</SIGNAL> 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO</SIGNAL> 1.5"
What do you mean?

Did you check diode mode to ground on coils?
Is the machine recognized into DFU?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wont charge 5V 0.280A without battery 20V with battery.
threads.message:
Sorry for the lack in information, this Mac boots fully with charged battery and I get 20V with battery installed but 0A so it wont charge, board alone takes 5V and 0.280A, T2 revive works all the way to the end but no change.

I dont even know where to start, but I just replaced <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and same thing.

Please advice.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wont charge 5V 0.280A without battery 20V with battery.
threads.message:
In this case you have a problem on USB-C area.
Compare diode mode readings and voltages between the 4 channels.

Did you test with correct (96/140W) charger?
Check <SIGNAL>UPC_I2C_INT_L</SIGNAL> signal.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wont charge 5V 0.280A without battery 20V with battery.
threads.message:
Yes 96W charger used.

All 4 <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP> were replaced from same donor board that had 20V 

Already replaced from donor board <CHIP>U2890</CHIP> and UB090

<SIGNAL>UPC_I2C_INT_L</SIGNAL> is 0V Diode 426 with board alone
Just in case <SIGNAL>I2C_PWR_SDA</SIGNAL>/SLC 1.8V with correct Diode read

Diode and voltages
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_RTC_X</SIGNAL> 3.3V 460 Diode
PP3V3_UPC_**_LDO in all 4 ports 480 diode and 3.3V
PP1V5_UPC_**_LDO_CORE in all 4 ports 520 diode and 1.5V

What else should I check

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wont charge 5V 0.280A without battery 20V with battery.
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>UPC_I2C_INT_L</SIGNAL> is 0V"
That is the problem; should find why stays low.
Any <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP> chip can pull it down, if detects a problem on its area.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wont charge 5V 0.280A without battery 20V with battery.
threads.message:
Diode read on <SIGNAL>UPC_I2C_INT_L</SIGNAL> is on par with know good.

Checked for shorts around all CD3217s and all is fine, I have had this board for a while now and I am ready to give up unless you think I should check something else.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wont charge 5V 0.280A without battery 20V with battery.
threads.message:
The problem is not on <SIGNAL>UPC_I2C_INT_L</SIGNAL> line; unless <RESISTOR>R5246</RESISTOR> is bad (open), or have corrosion between pads of J3000, or JB200.
This line is used to report problems on USB-C power channels.

You may have just a bad resistor, or broken trace; possibly input ESD diode damaged also.
Check diode mode to ground on J3300 and JB500.

When working on battery, do you get USB activity on all ports?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wont charge 5V 0.280A without battery 20V with battery.
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R5246</RESISTOR> ok
J3300 and JB500 are on par with known good board in diode mode
Mac only has USB activity in bottom left port (the one used for restoring) the other ports dont have voltage nor activity

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wont charge 5V 0.280A without battery 20V with battery.
threads.message:
Check L3500 and LB700 areas.
You should get 5V one coil, according with connected port.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wont charge 5V 0.280A without battery 20V with battery.
threads.message: LB700 and L3500 0 to 0.200V depending on port used

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wont charge 5V 0.280A without battery 20V with battery.
threads.message: L3500 should get voltage when you connect the device on working port.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wont charge 5V 0.280A without battery 20V with battery.
threads.message: Ok I have <SIGNAL>P5V_G3S</SIGNAL> missing and <CHIP>U3500</CHIP> needs that in order to work, when I check <CHIP>U7650</CHIP> I see that <SIGNAL>P5VG3S_EN_R</SIGNAL> missing, following that <SIGNAL>P5VG3S_EN</SIGNAL> is missing too as well as <SIGNAL>PMU_PVDDMAIN_EN</SIGNAL> and that only comes out of PMU, all AWAKE and SLPS2R signals are present, so far this is what I got, would that mean PMU is the problem?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wont charge 5V 0.280A without battery 20V with battery.
threads.message:
Do you get 1V8/<SIGNAL>3V3_G3S</SIGNAL>?
These (and also <SIGNAL>5V_G3S</SIGNAL>) must appear before S5 state.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wont charge 5V 0.280A without battery 20V with battery.
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_G3S</SIGNAL> missing not shorted, <CHIP>U8220</CHIP> has power but missing enable signal <SIGNAL>PP1V8G3S_EN</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3S</SIGNAL> missing too not shorted
Tried a new PMU with same result

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wont charge 5V 0.280A without battery 20V with battery.
threads.message: I'm wondering how this machine boots with all these missing voltages...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wont charge 5V 0.280A without battery 20V with battery.
threads.message: I will install it into its case again and test, but it only boots with battery connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wont charge 5V 0.280A without battery 20V with battery.
threads.message:
No reason to check for L3500, or LB700 voltage if board didn't boot.
Use a spare battery and test the board on the desk.

You should still inspect USB-C areas to find the main problem.
Remove the USB-C ports and check their terminals.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wont charge 5V 0.280A without battery 20V with battery.
threads.message:
In its case board does indeed still boots fully, 20V with battery connected but wont charge.
Left side has USB voltage and activity, right side is missing both, this gives me something to look for.
With battery alone no trackpad I still dont get voltage on those 2 coils (remember this board requires battery and trackpad to boot fully)
All my testing is done with new know working C ports

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wont charge 5V 0.280A without battery 20V with battery.
threads.message: Your problem should be on USB-C right side...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wont charge 5V 0.280A without battery 20V with battery.
threads.message:
Ok now I do have 20V in all ports without battery connected, I do have usb voltage and activity on left side, however on right side only UB300 has voltage and no activity, UB400 has none, I have already replaced UB000, UB090 with correct firmware, UB700, QB701, <CHIP>U8285</CHIP>, YB200, DB503 and both UB300/400 but same thing, no charge yet and USB problems with UB400, I have invested so much time on this board that I would hate to give up, customer is willing to wait so any additional help will be greatly appreciated.

Happy holidays by the way!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wont charge 5V 0.280A without battery 20V with battery.
threads.message:
Do you get LB700 voltage when insert an USB device on any right port?

Compare diode mode readings between left/right ports.
